channel.title: Quick question!
channel.description:
Well, I'm starting out coding now and i was wondering what is good to start out with like source and client?
Is project insanity any good? I just want to use a project to learn
So any suggestions, And i want a 317 base pi 2007-2006 maybe

item.title: Quick question!
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“John, post:6, topic:540093”][quote author=kronikz link=topic=658944.msg4407333#msg4407333 date=1392409818]
To be taken seriously, don’t refer to programming as coding.
[/quote]
Just because “coding” has earned a negative connotation from RSPS doesn’t mean it isn’t a widely recognized and accepted term. :P[/quote]

this. they’re synonyms with pretty much the same connotations.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question!
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

kronikz:

To be taken seriously, don’t refer to programming as coding.

Just because “coding” has earned a negative connotation from RSPS doesn’t mean it isn’t a widely recognized and accepted term.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question!
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Ambokile:

This is only really true with amateur programmers. I used to think that calling “programming” “coding” was stupid, until I got a job as a software developer and noticed that everyone calls it coding.

they’re all noobs

kronikz:

By the way, I never learned anything with private servers, you have to read books/tutorial first and practice what you’re learning. It’s not an easy progress, and if you really truly want to learn Java you will take my advice. If not then just look up a tutorial for whatever you want to do and not learn anything like most people.

pretty much answers your question

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question!
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

kronikz:

To be taken seriously, don’t refer to programming as coding.

This is only really true with amateur programmers. I used to think that calling “programming” “coding” was stupid, until I got a job as a software developer and noticed that everyone calls it coding.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question!
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

To be taken seriously, don’t refer to programming as coding.

By the way, I never learned anything with private servers, you have to read books/tutorial first and practice what you’re learning. It’s not an easy progress, and if you really truly want to learn Java you will take my advice. If not then just look up a tutorial for whatever you want to do and not learn anything like most people.

Trust me, someone a long time ago told me to do this and it’s the best feeling ever when you do something yourself and see it work ingame isntead of copy and pasting from a tutorial. I’m still learning a lot and I have a lot of people helping such as my main nigga Pure_ and Clawz Fury. They informed me that Runesource was a great source to use, so I recommend you read a book or follow a bunch of tutorials and wait for Asteria V2 to be released.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question!
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I didn’t learn shit from private servers. It’s all horrible code and poorly designed. And if you went for one of those solid frameworks it’d be boring as shit because there’d be no content, and you still wouldn’t understand it because you can’t learn Java by staring at a massive collection of code.

Just read a book or tutorial <3

Read full topic
